title: An introduction to maximal extractable value on Ethereum - EY
summary: In a new paper, EY explores the concept of Maximal Extractable Value (MEV) on Ethereum, a complex systemic challenge arising from overlapping preferences of market participants. MEV is defined as the value captured by participants in the Ethereum network, including Flashbots, which emerged serendipitously. The paper examines the MEV supply chain on both proof-of-work and proof-of-stake Ethereum, and discusses mitigation and redistribution strategies being developed by top researchers. The paper concludes that users may ultimately occupy the privileged position historically held by miners.

title: Filecoin Launches Ethereum-compatible Smart Contracts - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary: Filecoin, a blockchain for data storage, has launched Ethereum-compatible smart contracts, enabling decentralized applications (dApps) and "data DAOs" on its platform. This upgrade allows for on-chain analysis and perpetual storage of data, making it possible for scientists to conduct research on the blockchain. The smart contracts also bring the first decentralized finance (DeFi) applications to Filecoin, allowing users to stake and generate yield by lending FIL tokens to storage providers. This update is expected to make the network more economically sustainable and increase revenue for the protocol.

title: Ethereum price reaches lowest level relative to Bitcoin in 5 months - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum (ETH) price has been underperforming against Bitcoin (BTC) in the past six months, despite the upgrades to the Ethereum network. The ETH/BTC price ratio has been trading at around 0.068 since October 2022, with a recent breakdown below this level on March 15. This has led to a decrease in investor confidence, as seen in the decline in leverage long positions and the lack of demand for options contracts. The derivatives market indicates that professional traders are hesitant to place either bullish or bearish bets, and the 25% delta skew metric has reached its highest level of skepticism since November 2022.

title: Forget HTTP: Ethereum has a new URL standard that can't be blocked - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum has introduced a new URL standard called ERC-4804, which allows users to access decentralized applications (DApps) and non-fungible tokens (NFTs) directly without relying on centralized servers. The new standard, called "Web3 URLs," uses a "HTTP-style" URL to directly access on-chain Web3 content, such as DApps front-ends and NFTs. This means that users can type in "web3://" instead of "http://" in their browsers to access these decentralized services. The new standard is expected to be useful for DApps or websites at risk of censorship, such as Tornado Cash, and could potentially allow for "dynamic data" and interaction with other blockchains. However, the costs of using this new standard are still prohibitive for many applications, according to ETHStorage founder Qi Zhou.

title: Shapella Upgrade Brings Ethereum Closer to Long-awaited Withdrawals - Blockworks
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum has completed its Shapella upgrade on Goerli testnet, enabling withdrawals before the mainnet hard fork in early April. The upgrade combines the execution layer (Shanghai) with the consensus layer (Capella). Developers have tested the upgrade on public testnets Sepolia and Zhejiang. Withdrawals have already been processed on Goerli testnet, with 58,063 withdrawals processed and 124,246.82 (fake) ETH distributed. The upgrade brings Ethereum closer to allowing validators to withdraw their locked ether. Two types of withdrawals will be possible: partial withdrawals and full withdrawals. The Ethereum Foundation notes that the size of the exit queue will vary depending on the size of the validator set. Analysts expect the upgrade to be perceived as a significant de-risking for the Ethereum network.

title: Ethereum's Network-to-Value Ratio Slides to 3-Month Low as ETH Rallies 20% - CoinDesk
summary: Ethereum's network value ratio has reached a 3-month low as the price of ETH has rallied 20%. This is according to CoinDesk's latest financial news. The article also mentions Consensus 2024, CoinDesk's longest-running and most influential event that brings together all sides of the crypto, blockchain, and Web3 communities. To learn more and register for the event, visit consensus.coindesk.com.

title: SEC Chairman Gensler Suggests Again That Proof-of-Stake Tokens Are Securities: Report - CoinDesk
summary: SEC Chair Gensler reiterates stance that proof-of-stake tokens are securities, with a recent lawsuit supporting his argument. The NYAG sues KuCoin for offering tokens without proper registration, citing potential security laws violation.

title: Ethereum's Shapella hard fork on track for mainnet launch - crypto.news
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's Shapella hard fork is on track for mainnet launch after successful execution on the Goerli testnet. The upgrade unlocks $30 billion worth of ETH and introduces partial and full withdrawals. However, some testnet validators failed to upgrade their client software, causing delays in processing deposits. Ethereum developers are optimistic that validators will make necessary adjustments before the fork on the mainnet. The Shanghai upgrade will enable phased validator withdrawals, allowing users to access their staked ETH and staking rewards. The Ethereum Foundation has implemented measures to prevent a flood of ETH from hitting the market. Developers will convene for their biweekly call on March 16 to set a date for the mainnet upgrade.

title: Ethereum Displays Bullish Pattern, What To Expect Next? - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum has been displaying a bullish pattern, with a recent price appreciation that topped $1,600. The coin is currently consolidating, but there is potential for a breakthrough to $1,700. Technical indicators such as the Relative Strength Index and Moving Average Convergence Divergence are bullish, suggesting increased demand. However, a downtick in demand has been noted, and it is crucial for demand to climb further for ETH to reach $1,800. The Parabolic SAR also indicates a price direction and change.

title: The Peculiar Genius Behind Ethereum: Everything You Should Know - BSC NEWS
summary: Vitalik Buterin, the co-founder of Ethereum, has a unique mind that has been instrumental in the development of the platform. Buterin, who is on the autism spectrum, has a strong focus and dedication to computer science and mathematics, which has led to the creation of Ethereum. His intense focus and preferences for structure have been essential in the development of the platform, and his communication style has been an asset in communicating complex ideas to a broader audience. Despite facing challenges related to health and social interaction, Buterin's peculiar mind has revolutionized the world of cryptocurrency and paved the way for the development of decentralized applications.

title: Elon Musk Responds to Cathie Wood About Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH) Rising in Current Bank Crash - U.Today
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Elon Musk responded to Cathie Wood's tweet about the instability in the banking system and the rise of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. Musk agreed with Wood that regulators should focus on addressing weaknesses in the traditional banking system rather than attacking decentralized financial platforms. Musk also noted similarities between the current situation and the 1929 Great Depression. Additionally, investor Robert Kiyosaki predicted the collapse of a third bank, Signature Bank, which has cooperated with crypto companies.

title: Coinbase Issues Alert to Crypto Traders, Says It Will No Longer Support Six Ethereum-Based Altcoins - The Daily Hodl
summary: Coinbase to delist six Ethereum-based altcoins: RLY, YFII, MIR, OMG, LOOM, and REP. No longer available for trading starting March 29. Investors can still withdraw funds. Coinbase regularly reviews assets for listing standards.

SNX has seen a 126% price increase in 2023, but has retraced 10% in the last 24 hours.

title: What Is Ethereum 2.0 Staking? How To Earn With Eth Staking? - CoinGape
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Ethereum has upgraded to a proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanism, reducing energy consumption and scalability issues.

Ethereum staking allows users to participate in transaction validation and earn rewards.

To stake Ethereum, users need to hold 32 ETH, worth over INR 39 lakh.

Staking pools allow individuals to collaborate to meet the minimum requirement of 32 ETH.

Lido DAO provides liquidity for stakers, allowing them to receive stETH tokens to trade within the decentralized finance ecosystem.

The payout for Ethereum staking varies based on the number of validators participating and can range from 5% to 20% per year.

title: Ethereum whales accumulate $600M in ETH; Is the green still an anomaly? - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum whales have accumulated $600 million in ETH despite a recent price increase. Despite the gains on the charts, whales continued to buy ETH when it was still above $1,680. The Network Value to Transaction (NVT) signal is high, indicating that investors are pricing ETH at a premium. However, the circulation of ETH has increased over the last seven days, with 3.96 million units in circulation. Active addresses have also been increasing, with 24-hour active address count of 534,000. Exchanges have seen a close contest between outflows and inflows, with outflows slightly higher. While ETH may have a slight chance of appreciation in the short term, traders should be cautious of potential negative developments and contrasting market reactions.

The move comes as the NFT market experiences a slowdown, but Hedera continues to grow with new applications and partnerships. title: Coinbase Anticipates High Demand for Unstaking After Shanghai Upgrade - CryptoPotato
summary: Coinbase anticipates high demand for unstaking after Shanghai upgrade. Ethereum developers will enable unstaking next month, allowing users to withdraw staked Ether. Coinbase expects weeks to months for processing requests, and provides liquid staking option called cbETH to account for delay. SEC recently fined Kraken $30 million for unregistered securities offering in staking service, and Coinbase has criticized the enforcement action.

title: Ethereum: Final Testnet Upgrade Brings Shanghai Closer Than Ever - TradingView
summary: Ethereum's Shanghai upgrade is one step closer to activation on the mainnet blockchain after a successful testnet upgrade on Goerli. The upgrade, known as "Shapella," is expected to occur sometime in April, pending finalization of the mainnet launch date. The upgrade includes a hard fork and is being closely monitored by developers and validators.

title: Ethereum Completes Goerli Testnet - CryptoDaily
summary: Ethereum developers have completed the final testnet for the Shapella upgrade, which is set to take place in early April. The Goerli testnet saw low validator participation, but the upgrade is still expected to go live on the mainnet. Once live, validators will be able to withdraw their staked ether and earn rewards. This is a significant milestone for the Ethereum network as it transitions to a proof-of-stake mechanism.

title: NFT Sector Keeps on Developing – Number of Unique Ethereum NFT Traders Surged 276% in 2022 - Blockchain News
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

NFT trading activity on the Ethereum blockchain surged in 2022, with a 276% increase in unique active traders compared to the previous year. Despite negative market conditions, the number of active NFT traders remained stable, with a slight drop in the fourth quarter followed by a rebound in the first quarter of 2023. The number of trades initially plummeted but bounced back, indicating promising signs for the NFT sector. The report highlights the resilience of NFT traders during challenging times and the potential for increased mainstream adoption as crypto prices are expected to rise.

title: Gensler suggests staking token operators should 'seek to come into compliance' - Cointelegraph
summary: SEC Chair Gary Gensler has suggested that staking token operators should "seek to come into compliance" as he believes proof-of-stake coins may be securities. He has expressed this view multiple times, including during a commission meeting on cybersecurity issues and in a tweet. Gensler has stated that the Howey test, which dates back to 1946, is used to identify securities, and that staking is "another indicia that the investing public is anticipating profits based on the efforts of others." This comes after the SEC forced cryptocurrency exchange Kraken to discontinue its staking service and pay a $30 million settlement earlier this year, which some saw as a sign of increased enforcement actions in the cryptocurrency industry.

title: 'ETH is deflationary' - Why this is important under recent circumstances - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is experiencing a surge in demand, which may continue in the long term due to its deflationary milestone achieved through EIP 1559 last year. The network has burned over 3 million ETH, worth $9.09 billion, reducing the post-Merge total supply by 62,000 ETH. This has led to a 0.42% deflationary rate, making ETH a preferable asset class in both the short and long term. The demand for ETH has been confirmed through exchange outflows, which have reached a 3-month high. Shorts traders have suffered losses as the price has pivoted, while leverage demand has declined since February but has recently picked up. The market may become more volatile if leverage continues to rise.

title: What Crypto Does Elon Musk Own? | Everything You Need To Know - Bankless Times
summary: Elon Musk owns very little cryptocurrency, only 0.25 Bitcoin given to him by a friend. His companies, Tesla and the Boring Company, have invested in cryptocurrency, with Tesla owning around 10,500 Bitcoin and the Boring Company accepting Dogecoin as payment. In 2021, Tesla invested $1.5 billion in Bitcoin, but sold 75% of it a year later, citing the need to increase liquidity. Musk has expressed his support for cryptocurrency, but has also expressed concerns about its environmental impact and has played it safe with his investments.
